body.p:
Yours 3d. inst to hand, for which
I offer many thanks.

Since my last the congregation agreed to have
a temporary place of worship opened. Mr. de Silva
officiated on 1st days of Pesach & will continue so that
after all my first proposition has been adopted.

I note your remarks about Gutheim. You
are in error in thinking that you had previously
answered my inquiries. Like myself you have
been forgetful & not sufficiently explicit several
times. I have always made full allowances
for your inadvertence & knowing what I have
recently undergone you ought to do the same
for me. Respecting the inscription I am
happy that you have given me right. With
regard to the Organ, you “did the thing” just
as I wanted it, neither too much nor too little.

You will please have the Hebrew made to
? into the ceiling of the ark, between
the cornice & the sliding doors

Please procure a “Shophar” & also
a Hanuca lamp.

Regarding the number of bells for
the sepharim, please get even so 5
in all; the last two perhaps you may
as well have made somewhat plainer if there
is any great difference in cost; if not then
let them be like others.

You will please have the table covers
made as you pupise sixty three by forty four inches.

p.rend: Diagram of table cover, noting that it should be 63 inches by 44 inches in size.

body.p:
I believe I have said all that is necessary
above. It is proper to add that as a matter
of form I asked my old friend Mr Touro
if he approved of the above to which he answered
as usual that I must take the blame or credit
of everything.

As to the convention I spoke of it to
every Jew I met with & the German Congre
gation had already acted as I wanted mine to do
but some of my wiseacres preferred taking
two weeks to consider about it, so we hold
an adjourned meeting next Sunday to decide
on the matter. I shall insist on sending
a delegate & I think when I talk to them
as I intend to in opening the meeting,
there will be little farther hesitancy.

I would have sent you a telegraph
ie dispatch as you request, but
on inquiry at the telegraph office
find that the wires are down bet
ween Mobile & Montgomery so we would
lose 2 & perhaps 3 days, therefore concluded
to write by mail at once to day.

The Hebrew Benevolent Association
at last annual meeting elected me
President. They require some one
to take the lead again for a while
to get things straight, to draft a
constitution & by laws fit for the
government of such a society, & to procure
a charter. I know there was great diss
atisfaction & fearing that the society
might be dissolved I accepted the
office which I held from for the two first
years of its existence. The duties are severe
& take up a great deal of time if properly performed.

I have had two very disagreeable questions
to decide & act upon in my congregation, which
when we meet or I have more time I shall
be happy to communicate & ask your opinion
on my judgment & acts in the premises.

Will you be so kind as to inform me how L A
Levy Jr. who married Isabella Levy of New York is affected
by his legal though illegal marriage. He is a Levite
& I presume his marriage is not recognized by
us in calling him to “sephar” in “Schule”. Yet
if we “do not go behind the curtain” he has a regular
“Ketuba”. His offspring I know we regard as “momscien?”

He is a very good man but I will act according
to our law to the letter. Do give my fond love to my dear little
aunt husband &c when you see them & believe me yours sincerely

My worthy old friend Mr Touro received your
letter in due course acknowledging
receipt of draft. He desires me to
forward his best respects to you
I have to send this letter by the extra mail to Mobile
may it reach you in the enjoyment of perfect health

p.rend: The 3 lines are written sideways in the center of the page.

body.p:
In a week or two I shall know pretty well
whether or not I shall see you in June.
If I do not leave here I will write you
at length on the subject of securing
a lecturer for the congregation
